channel.title: This weird client
channel.description:
I have a very weird client it doesnt have any .java files in it all it has is run and all kinds of .class files it also has this "theme.jar file and client.jar"
How do i get the client.java to show up then gui.java to show up and all the other ones :confused:

the delta client i have has anti leech so idk dont ask me about anti leech cuz idk crap about it.

Read full topic

item.title: This weird client
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

[quote=“Muroth, post:5, topic:344221”]The client you downloaded could be a ‘closed client’, which is a client where the person who releases it deletes all the java files and leaves the uneditable files. You could decompile the class files, but that would take forever, and I sense you don’t know how to decompile yet…

BUT there is a chance that he/she hid the files. Here’s how to unhide hidden files/folders.

For XP, on the top of the folder, go to “Tools>Folder Options…>View>”
Look for Hidden files and folders, and click on “Show hidden files and folders” and hit apply.

Not sure about Windows Vista/7 because I don’t have/use it(:[/quote]

vista (maybe 7?), you go to the search option (lil window orb thingy in corner), type in “folder options” and click the folder, then unhide “hidden folders” or something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: This weird client
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

I don’t suggest decompiling the client you’re using. I got a good feeling you won’t know how to get everything working… ^^

But just use a different client base, i’d just give up on this client. There’s thousands of other ones out there, so why not? (:

Read full topic

item.title: This weird client
item.dc:creator: @devin_ur_acc devin ur acc
item.description:
@devin_ur_acc wrote:

i did that nothing happened is there anyway i can make them or can you tell me how to decompile ill do whatever it takes to get this client running.

Read full topic

item.title: This weird client
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

The client you downloaded could be a ‘closed client’, which is a client where the person who releases it deletes all the java files and leaves the uneditable files. You could decompile the class files, but that would take forever, and I sense you don’t know how to decompile yet…

BUT there is a chance that he/she hid the files. Here’s how to unhide hidden files/folders.

For XP, on the top of the folder, go to “Tools>Folder Options…>View>”
Look for Hidden files and folders, and click on “Show hidden files and folders” and hit apply.

Not sure about Windows Vista/7 because I don’t have/use it(:

Read full topic

item.title: This weird client
item.dc:creator: @devin_ur_acc devin ur acc
item.description:
@devin_ur_acc wrote:

well i edited the .class files and screwed them. so i re downloaded the client and its back to normal.

but now what u were say there is only .class files
no client.java egui.java/gui.java they r all class files
how i unhide the files??

Read full topic

item.title: This weird client
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

gether:

lmao ur trying 2 leech a client…go and make it so hidden files show up…lol

And you didn’t when you first came here, and new everything about RSPS, and how to program them like jagex, right? We all start from somewhere, how about you try to help him.

@ontopic - Click the client.java (right click > properties > open with notepad), now all .java files will be opened with a notepad, the class files you don’t have to edit, just leave them there.

Read full topic
